Feedback
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &app; application or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; application enables you to monitor and view system log files. To view system log files, you may need to log in as root.

sect1.title: Getting Started
sect1.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:
When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains menubar, display area, scrollbars, and statusbar.

sect1.para: When you start &app;, the application displays the /var/adm/messages log file by default.

sect2.title: To View a Log File
sect2.para: To view a log file, choose LogOpen. In the Open new logfile dialog, enter the name of the log file that you want to open, then click OK. Use the scrollbars to scroll through the log file.

You can open as many log files as you want. &app; displays one log file at a time in the System Log Viewer window. To display another log file that is already open in &app;, choose LogSwitch Log. To continue to move through the open log files, choose LogSwitch Log .

sect2.title: To View More Information About a Log File Entry

listitem.para: The date of the log entry.
The name of the process that caused the log entry.
A description of the log message if available.

sect2.title: To Monitor Log Files
sect2.para: You can use &app; to monitor selected log files. When you select a log file to monitor, &app; displays the most recent entries from the log file in a separate window. &app; updates the Monitoring logs window to display new entries as they are added.
To monitor a log file, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Select the log file that you want to monitor in the left pane of the Monitor options dialog.
To hide the main &app; window while you are monitoring log files, select the Hide app checkbox.

sect2.para: &app; displays the log file in a Monitoring logs window. &app; can monitor several log files simultaneously but the application only displays one file at a time in the Monitoring logs window. &app; adds a tab for each log file that the application is monitoring.

sect2.title: To View a Calendar
sect2.para: To view a calendar, choose ViewCalendar. The dates for which log files exist are displayed in bold. To view the log files for a particular date, select the date in the calendar.

sect2.title: To View Log File Properties
sect2.para: To view the properties of the log file, choose LogProperties. The Log stats dialog displays the following information about the file:

listitem.para: Size of the file in bytes.
Date the file was last modified.
Date of the most recent log entry.
Number of lines in the file.

sect2.title: To Close a Log File
sect2.para: To close a log file, choose LogClose. If you close the last log file that is open, the application exits.
